snippet: At this week’s pride festivities in Indiana, gay residents say much has changed for the better since passage of the state’s religious exceptions law.
abstract: Indianapolis Journal; Indiana's lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender population kicks off nine-day pride celebration in capital Indianapolis; event comes amid aftermath of state's religious exceptions law, which many viewed as license to discriminate against same-sex couples and sparked furious backlash, prompting many state residents and businesses to declare their support for equal rights.
lead_paragraph: At this week’s pride festivities in Indiana, gay residents say much has changed for the better since passage of the state’s religious exceptions law.

headline.print_headline: City Rallies Around Its Gay Citizens After a Law Sets Off a Flood of Support
headline.main: Indianapolis Rallies Around Its Gay Citizens After a Law Sets Off a Flood of Support

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
